threats.name: Sybil Attack
threats.desc: Adversary generates mass pseudonymous identities to flood peer sets, manipulate consensus, or poison routing.

threats.name: Eclipse Attack
threats.desc: Adversary monopolizes victim's inbound/outbound slots to isolate them from the honest network (partition/censorship).

threats.name: Downgrade Attack
threats.desc: Attacker forces victim to use older, insecure protocol versions or weaker ciphers during negotiation.

threats.name: Capability Spoofing
threats.desc: Node claims capabilities it does not possess to attract traffic or work it cannot/will not perform.

threats.name: Identity Theft
threats.desc: Exfiltration of private keys (disk/memory) allowing impersonation of a trusted node.

threats.name: Replay Attack
threats.desc: Valid signed messages re-broadcast to duplicate effects or bypass nonces.

threats.name: Confused Deputy
threats.desc: Low-trust child induces high-trust parent to perform sensitive actions on its behalf.

threats.name: Lease Drift
threats.desc: Clock skew exploited to extend authority windows or bypass expiry checks.

threats.name: History Forgery
threats.desc: Modification of local logs or evidence to hide past actions or alter truth.

threats.name: Equivocation
threats.desc: Presenting conflicting versions of 'truth' (e.g., ledgers) to different peers.

threats.name: Computation DoS
threats.desc: Inducing expensive parsing, validation, or inference tasks to starve the node.

threats.name: Spawn Storm
threats.desc: Malicious or buggy recursion causing unbounded creation of sub-holons/tasks.

threats.name: Metadata Leakage
threats.desc: Operational facts revealed by traffic patterns, timing, or volume even if payloads encrypted.

threats.name: Model-Mediated Leakage
threats.desc: Secrets serialized into durable artifacts via tool outputs or prompt context.

threats.name: Metric Gaming
threats.desc: Optimizing for specific gate metrics while undermining the underlying security goal.

identity_and_replay: Identity freshness enforcement for Tier2+ authority paths
delegation_and_authz: Permeability receipts as the only cross-boundary authority entrance
integrity_and_admission: Authoritative facts authenticated by signature or authority seal
confidentiality_and_injection: Dual-lattice taint/classification enforcement on boundary emissions
Context firewall and capability-gated tool mediation

verification_economics: Maintain bounded decode and collection constraints on all anti-entropy and admission paths.
Preserve logarithmic proof economics for identity and receipt membership verification.
Prefer batch-anchored verification to avoid linear per-fact signature amplification.

cryptography_posture.pqc_note: PQC migration is deferred; controls align to active RFC-0020 signature and seal mechanisms.
